intro: Thomsonaria globosa, commonly known as the globular thomsonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which come in shades of red, orange, and yellow, bloom in summer and attract various pollinators. Thomsonaria globosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
